intro: Chiococca pueblensis, commonly known as the Puebla chiococca, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
